article_title: Man faces federal drug, weapons charges in Pittsburgh
article_text:
Porter faces 15 years to life in prison, a fine of up to $2.5 million or both.

The U.S. Attorney's Office said Porter has been convicted of nine felonies, including three drug trafficking crimes and two aggravated assaults, in eight prior cases.

Gerard Porter, 38, formerly of the North Side, is charged with possession of heroin with intent to distribute, possession of a firearm and possession of a firearm by a felon.

A federal grand jury in Pittsburgh indicted a man with a lengthy criminal history for heroin trafficking and firearms crimes, the U.S. Attorney's Office announced Monday.
